Job Title: Supplier Quality Process Engineer

Location: Morton Grove, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Quality Assurance

Description:
We’re Hiring for Supplier Quality Process Engineer! If you are excited and passionate about helping #LetsSolveWater, consider joining our team today! Xylem, Inc. is a leading global water technology company servicing more than 150 countries and is dedicated to solving the world’s most challenging water issues. We are looking for individuals to join our mission by exceeding customer expectations through smart sustainable solutions. At Xylem, you will have the opportunity to solve water by participating in our paid Volunteer Program, Xylem Watermark!THE ROLE: Supplier Quality Process Engineer to help execute their strategy of technological excellence and to increase focus on delighting customers. This role is responsible for assessment, continuous monitoring, and ultimate effectiveness of process performance from supplier selection through product integration. This role is focused on proactively ensuring Xylem ALWAYS receives material and components that are within specification and meet or exceed the demands of the intended application by ensuring suppliers implement and maintain adequate quality control processes and systems that align with Xylem process and performance requirements. Key success in this role will be the ability to perform failure/risk evaluations and root cause determination in partnership with a Cross-Functional Team (CFT). Supplier management will also require partnership with Sourcing and Engineering groups to assure implementation of the best possible solutions.CORE RESPONSIBILITIES: To perform the job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Utilize information derived from data to identify systematic approaches for increasing repeatability and other continuous improvement activities to drive savings, collect, analyze, and report data to internal & external customers on process performance measurementExecute product audits including material identification/verification & traceabilityDefine and manage in-process testing and inspection activitiesManage 8D Corrective Action for all Quality inputs, including internal and customer-identified defectsComplete PPAP/ISIR for purchased parts defined as CTQ/SPC by engineeringIdentify impact of engineering change notifications for Quality processes and documents and determine any steps necessary for change authorization with internal stakeholder alignmentPerform Process Failure Mode and Effect Analysis (PFMEA) to identify risks to product qualityWitness product validation and verificationCoordinate material segregation and dispositionDevelop Process Control Plans to standardize and control manufacturing processEnsure customer satisfaction through conformance and defect resolutionConduct/assist in third party regulatory and safety agency auditsParticipate in the Xylem (XGP) Supplier Assessment to qualify capable suppliers that meet engineering, procurement and quality requirementsPerform on-site or remote risk assessment audits at Xylem suppliers worldwide based on Xylem supplier policy & quality management system requirements for recommendations on approval, reject or development decisions and follow through on capabilityCreate a development plan for suppliers to support performance targets and monitor performance in meeting Xylem goals.Partner with Sourcing to implement supplier quality requirements during the Request for Quote processRepresent Xylem QA at site meetings and submit daily reports to Xylem Morton GroveQUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s Degree in applied science, or engineering field. Advanced certification as a CQE, CQM, LSS greenbelt or blackbelt a plus.Three to Five (3-5) years prior experience in Quality Assurance with a consumer product manufacturerBackground or substantial knowledge of six sigma problem solving methodologiesStrong proficiency of Microsoft Office Applications, Business Objects, Minitab Team Guru, etc.Detailed working knowledge of ISO procedures and Quality Systems Demonstrated experience working with manufacturers, suppliers and distributorsKnowledge in the areas of Engineering, Service, Manufacturing, and Quality Strong background in Hands-on Metrology skillsKnowledge of basic quality topics and metrics like APQP, Statistical Process Control methods, 8D Methodology and Process Capability Index (CPK) is highly desirable Prior experience with UL, CSA, FM, NSF, MTL, ASME Code compliance a plusPossess strong decision-making, analytical and problem-solving, and negotiating skillsDemonstrated exceptional communication skills; verbal, written, and presentationAbility to provide informative and professional assistance when working with the public/customers and co-workers and maintain positive interpersonal relationships which encourage openness Successful experience working in challenging business environment where skills/abilities were stretched.Automotive or aerospace experience a plusAbility to read and interpret mechanical and electrical drawings.Ability to manage time effectively.Reliable transportation for local travel and off shift workWilling to travel up to 25% to suppliers worldwide for audit & development activities Experience in a Union manufacturing environment is a plusWork Environment:In this role, the working environment is both office and manufacturing shop floor where PPE and safety protocols are observed. The physical demands may include but are not limited to good vision and hearing; ability to stand and walk, lift, and carry up to 35 pounds occasionally and/or 10 pounds occasionally; stoop, crouch, kneel reach for and handle items, pick, pinch or otherwise work with the fingers and use the fingertips to perceive attributes of objects such as size, shape and surface finish. Work is performed in a typical manufacturing plant environment under the following conditions: noise, fumes, dust, high voltage electric current, and high-Powered Industrial Vehicle (PIV) traffic. Some duties are performed outdoors and may involve exposure to inclement weather conditions. In addition, this role may require extended hours to meet customer requirements. At Xylem, we embrace diversity and strive to create avenues where employees feel valued and appreciated through our DE&I initiatives and Employee Resources Groups (ERG). Xylem is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action workplace. Xylem prohibits discrimination, harassment of any kind and does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex or sexual orientation (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, marital status, medical conditions or disability, genetic information, age, or other non-merit factors. The estimated salary range for this position is $68,500 to $122,500. Starting pay is dependent on multiple factors, such as skills, experience and work location, and is not typically at the top of the range. At Xylem we offer a competitive compensation package with a generous benefit package, including Medical, Dental, Vision plans, 401(k) with company contribution, paid time off, paid parental leave and tuition reimbursement.Join the global Xylem team today! Xylem is a team creating advanced technology solutions to the world’s water challenges through developing new technologies and services that will improve the way water is used, conserved, and re-used in the future is central to our work. Our products and services move, treat, analyze, monitor, and return water to the environment, in public utility, industrial, residential, and commercial building services settings. Xylem also provides a leading portfolio of smart metering, network technologies and advanced analytics solutions for water, electric and gas utilities.Disclaimer: The information listed within this job description is designed to indicate the general nature of work expected for this position and shall not be viewed as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required in this position. Employees must be able to perform the essential functions of the position satisfactorily and if requested, reasonable accommodations will be made to enable employees with disabilities to perform the essential functions of their job absent undue hardship. Xylem reserves the right to modify this job description or assign other duties to this position as needed.

Experience Level (if available): None
